conclusion: Determine the electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square.
Positive charges +q at points A and B; negative charges -q at points C and D.
Intersection of diagonals (point O) is at the center of the square.
Distance from any vertex to the center O is Lâˆš2/2.
Electric field E due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric field due to each charge at distance d is E_each = k(2q)/L^2.
Electric fields due to +q at A and B point away; due to -q at C and D point towards.
Electric field vectors from opposite corners cancel out in both directions.
Resultant electric field at point O is zero.
